name: How calm is complacent consumption
description:
Why do you spend your money on junk food, your hard-earned cash on cotton candy?
— Isaiah 55:2, The Message


I walk along with yous beside myself
Yous speak and say, The view is nice it seems
Do you agree? yous ask repeatedly

a reel a light images loop: a screen &
tape: [flapping - - - catching - - going]
yous shatter into you and you and
you coagulate form you/s as
light spasms struggle to be
out, immanent ants emerge, some/thing
upon their backs, crawling around
a winding clock ever never
starting: a question and its
answer; go, stay, come (back)
silent metronome paces time
edge-to-tick-to-edge-to-tick-to-
you/s as punctuation in the air on
the line, tape flaps encore une fois,
play(ing) purpose(less) written-light
??? beauty of ???
in/coherence that I in/jest
anyway any way
as long as (because) —
the view is "nice"

---

Original poetry by metanivek, 2021.
